definition: the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]

sentences.english: For the Sun Yat-sen led the revolution, when many Japanese friends to support him.
sentences.chinese: 對於領導革命的孫文，當年有許多日本友人支持他。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen was a prominent dissident who had been exiled from China.
sentences.chinese: 孫文是從中國流亡的一位著名不同政見者。

definition: Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
president (of a country)/same as 總統|总统
Lin Zexu or Lin Tse-hsu "Commissioner Lin" (1785-1850), Qing official whose anti-opium activities led to first Opium war with Britain 1840-1842
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
